templates.title: Templates

templateLinks.title: Assign work via link
templateLinks.description: You can create a link and share it with your students or post it publicly.
templateLinks.confirmDeleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete the share link? This will make the template inaccessible via the current link.
templateLinks.description2: Anyone who opens the link will automatically be assigned the work according to this template and will appear in your Works section. If it's a new student, you will receive a notification and see them in the Students section.
templateLinks.deleteShareKeyDetails: This will make the template unavailable via the current link, but the works that have already been assigned will remain with the students.

empty.noFolder: You don't have any templates without folder
empty.noTemplates: You haven't created any templates yet
empty.noMatch: No templates match your filter criteria
empty.noTemplatesInFolder: You don't have any templates in this folder

hint.adjust: Try adjusting your filters to find what you're looking for

folder.message: Are you sure you want to delete this folder? This action cannot be undone.
folder.moveTemplates: All templates in this folder will be moved to the root folder.
folder.deleteSubfolders: All subfolders in this folder will be deleted.

validation.titleLength: Title must be at most 100 characters
validation.descriptionLength: Description must be at most 1000 characters

createForStudent.title: Individual assignment for a Student
createForStudent.description: An individual assignment for the student will be created from the template. Before sending, you can modify it — this will not affect the template.

createNewTemplate.title: Create a Template
createNewTemplate.description: You can prepare a template in advance and later assign it to students or create a public link to share it directly or post it in any group, chat, etc.

templates.addFirstStudentDescription: You don't have any students on our platform yet. Send a link to invite students and immediately assign work.

tooltips.dragAndDrop: Drag to move or click to open menu

hiddenText.title: Text Input
hiddenText.hint: A text field where students must enter the correct answer themselves or drag an answer card from the "Draggable Answers" section if it's added to the task.

draggableAnswers.title: Draggable Answers
draggableAnswers.hint: Answer panel. Students can drag them to the 'Text Input' field. Add 'Text Input' elements to the task and answers will be automatically added to the panel.

multipleChoice.title: Dropdown List
multipleChoice.hint: Dropdown list with multiple options where students must select only one correct answer.

sortingOrdering.title: Sorting
sortingOrdering.hint: Panel with cards that students need to order. Can be vertical (for sentences) or horizontal (for words or letters). Press Enter to split a card, delete space between cards to merge them. Cards will be randomly shuffled for students.

studentsSection.title: Free-form Answer
studentsSection.hint: Student can enter any text, record voice or add image.
studentsSection.hint2: Teacher can specify evaluation criteria, for example for EGE, OGE, or other exams.
studentsSection.hint3: Can be switched to simple mode if only text is needed.

criteria.aiDisabled: AI Validation is disabled by the teacher
criteria.notAvailableInPreview: Unavailable in preview mode but will be available to students

studentsSection.criteriaDescriptionHint: Used for AI validation, invisible for students
studentsSection.noExamsFound: Not found, but you can add your own criteria...

image.title: Image
image.hint: Upload, crop and insert an image into your task. You can select a file on your device, drag and drop a file or paste an image from clipboard.

audio.title: Audio
audio.hint: Add audio that students can play directly in the task. You can select a file on your device or record your own voice.

embed.title: External Content
embed.hint: Add external web content to your task: YouTube, Wordwall, Google Docs or any other website that supports iframe.

checklist.title: Checkbox List
checklist.hint: A block with multiple answer options where students can select one or more correct answers by checking boxes.

part.hintDelete: To delete- just remove a text

help.title: The same set of elements is available on the editor toolbar. You can combine different mechanics in one task

table.title: Table
table.hint: A table helps improve formatting and alignment of elements. You can place text and interactive elements in cells, adjust column alignment, and add rows and columns. Avoid adding too many columns — on mobile devices they may not fit on the screen, so use vertical tables instead. Table borders are not visible to students.

tip.title: Teacher Note
tip.hint: Any notes that are visible only to you and not to students. Here you can add, for example, the correct answer or additional criteria for yourself.

onboarding.intro: Let's get to know the platform

createTasks.title: Create a Task
createTasks.hint:
A task is a separate exercise (activity, task). It can contain text, images, audio and various interactive elements for student response.

Large tasks are better divided into several small ones, so students can complete them more conveniently, and you can track progress.

This is like puzzle pieces from which you will assemble works for students. One task can be included in several works and templates.

createTemplate.title: Create a Work Template
createTemplate.hint:
A template allows you to combine several tasks into one ready-made typical work. You can add both previously created tasks and new ones - they are automatically included in the template.

The template can be assigned to students as work.
createTemplate.description: You can prepare a template in advance and later assign it to students or share a link

assignWorks.title: Assign work to students
assignWorks.hint:
Now you have a ready template that can be assigned to students as work.

In the Templates section, select the action "Assign", copy the link and share it with students. Everyone who opens the link will automatically be assigned work according to this template.

In the Works section, you can track progress and check completed work for each student.

inviteStudents.title: Track progress and check work
inviteStudents.hint:
Sent the link? Great, now when a new student opens the link, you will receive a notification.

In the Students section, you can keep track of lessons - specify the cost, add and deduct lessons. When paid lessons run out, our bot will gently remind the student about it.

In the Works section, you can track progress and check completed work for each student.

manageBalance.title: Student balance management
manageBalance.hint: You can add and deduct lessons on the student's balance for transparent accounting. You and students can find all operations in the "Transactions" section.

onboarding.intro_setup: Choose your interface language and theme
onboarding.intro_resize: It's more convenient for teachers to work on a computer or tablet. Expand the window - click "..." in the header and select "fullscreen"
onboarding.intro_tg: If working inside Telegram is unfamiliar to you, you can use the platform through the website
onboarding.completed: Congratulations! You have successfully completed the express training and can now use the platform independently.
onboarding.justInCase: There is an "Instruction" item in the menu — if you forget something, you can check it.
